r_text: Visit it if you are in the center of Nicosia old city...one of the oldest church in island...the morning hours is open

I love Churches, Orthodox Churches especially due to their supreme emphasis on the de-centralisation of power. In layman's terms this means that Orthodoxy in each nation in which it's found is its own national church, This liberty and autonomy means that the aesthetics of their…
It is the only church that has seats at various levels that I have ever experience. The old church will amaze you.

The Church of Archangel Michael Trypiotis is just opposite the church of Saint Savvas, close to Leiki Geitonia and Ledra street. here you can find some impressing icons, and a very beautiful iconostasis. The interior is rather dark, and the gold and silver details multiply the…

In the heart of the old city of Nicosia, this church has a rich interior, with silver covered icons. The story of the church and of the name of the church is provided outside the church in many languages.
Beautiful place and glad to see careful reconstruction going on outside. Possibly the best looking church in the city.

The Greek Orthodox church of Archangel Michael Tripiotis within the walls of Nicosia, is one of the most beautiful churches on our island. It was built in 1695. It is a special example of architecture, made with smoothed stone, has three naves and a dome that almost has the aspect of a square. The rich interior is decorated with an ornately carved golden iconostasi and gold/silver-covered icons. An interesting example of the Franco-Byzantine style.

This orthodox church is located in the centre of Nicosia next to the shopping streets It is made of limestone and has a lot of coat of arms outside These used to decorade older buildings of the 13 and 14 centures mostly of the Luisinians.The iconostasis inside is woodcarved and goldplated IT is simple and beautiful

The outside of the church is bring worked an and indeed much of Nicosia is under construction, This is a pretty church internally although the modern fixtures do impact the visitors view. ~You need to look past that to appreciate the place. As a tourist I was made to feel uncomfortable which impacted the experience - but I was visiting late in the day. I am sure this would not be the case during more regular hours. I would recommend visiting before 4pm.

The Church of Archangelos Michael Trypiotis was built in stones in 1695 within the Old Town Walls.Its architecture is not very impressive from the outside; however it has a beautiful and unique Bells Tower and it is extremely beautiful from the inside.Although it is not allowed to photograph inside the Church, but there was a very nice multilingual lady who provided us with brochures and information and also allowed us to have few photos without flash.The Church Altar, the Stand and the Icons are fascinating; every item of furniture is a piece of art by itself; the walls are covered with a beautiful Icons and nice painting.

Worth visiting because inside it is not the typical way a Christian Orthodox Church is. The seating area is more like a theater's arrangement, very interesting and different. Beautiful small church, very peaceful.
One of the 7 Greek-Orthodox Churches downtown old historic Nicosia center. Small, charming, reminds Byzantium. Tourist in Nicosia must visit.
Beautiful church located just off the pedestrian area of Ledra in downtown Nicosia. Well worth getting side tracked to go and see.
This was one of a number of Byzantine churches we visited. It was so beautiful and peaceful and well worth the stop. Keep an eye out for the signs in the village as it can be easily missed.
Would recommend going with the free Cyprus Walking Tour to get some understanding of the history and symbolism of the church.Beautiful church to visit.

We visited the Church of Archangel Michael to see the beautiful icons. It was being set up for a wedding later that day and the setting was just perfect -so peaceful surrounded by such beauty.The iconostasis that holds the icons was carved in 1812 and gilded in 1816 and the icons are amazing. The icon to St Michael is from 1634 so must have been brought to the church. The icon showing the Madonna and Child dates from the 15th century it is unusual because it shows Mary's parents Anna and Joachim.When visiting Nicosia the church is worth a visit.

Like many places in the walled city, this is a palimpsest: Originally built in the 1500's, with bits of gothic masonry up-cycled into the mix, it underwent a refurbishment in the 1600's. It is very much a working parish church, but with an idiosyncratic layout, additions from various eras, and, of course, a rich past...
Some of the icons in the Church are very old and beautiful. Do take a look. Remember to show respect though; no hangs behind your back! :-)
Nice to visit shortly if in the area. It could be part of a walking tour of old Nicosia. It is very nice insight even though this may not seem so from the outside.

Lots of details make this church and ideal wedding venue; the location, the availability of a parking for the guests, the beautifully crafted handmade golden temple, the way guests can seat around the couple and watch I obstructed, the priest who is very modern and polite, the asking price of 100 euros for the wedding service when all other churches in Nicosia ask from 250 up to 500 euros...in A Cypriot wedding only the best man pays for the church...even if there is a best woman...( they call it that way). Very peaceful, beautiful Byzantine icons, it's allowed to photograph them...in some churches it is forbidden.

When touring down-town Nicosia, you must go visit this beautiful church, which is located on a road parallel to Onasagorou and Ledras street. Especially during Holy week (preferable Good Friday) it is must-see location. Please note that just like any other churches on the island, apparel should be decent.

I attended a wedding there recently and the church is wonderful. The chairs as placed on raised floor so have a perfect view wherever you sit. The priest was very nice as well and overall its a wonderful place for a traditional wedding.
Wonderful architecture and history. A rare chance to see and read about the history of the church and what it used to be in another life.

The church of Archangelos Michail Trypiotis, a three - aisle Franco - Bysantine basilica, is located within the Walled City, in the south part of Lefkosia, in a quarter which had been rich and important before the division of the city. The church was built in 1695 and the beautiful wooden carved iconostasis dates back to 1812. Constructed with clearly cut stones, the church has distinguished internal features and very important icons. Most impressive is the big icon of Archangelos Michail, protector of the city from flooding by the Pedieos river, dated 1634. Exceptional is the 15th century small rectangular icon of Mary with baby Jesus in her arms, between her parents Joachim and Anna. This is the most ancient icon in the church. Very interesting are the two doors on the southern and western external walls, since they follow different architectural styles, such as romanesque, gothic and renaissance.You may visit the church early in the morning or afternoon at about 5 o´clock and certainly every Sunday morning before 10 to attend the orthodox divine liturgy. The best season to visit Trypiotis and the other 10 churches, orthodox and catholic, of the south part of the Lefkosia Walled City, is Easter time, especially on Good Friday.

Church of Archangel Michael Trypiotis is a stone-built church of 16th century, during Venetian period at Cyprus. Located within the walls of Nicosia, just in the historic centre of the town, very easy to find and of great interest. Worth while to visit and for those who love these kind of small old churches like me, at the same area is Ayios Savvas, Panayia Chrysaliniotissa, Ayios Kassianos and Panayia Phaneromeni, as Cypriots are very faithfull.
